title: BBC Local Live: Kent updates on Thursday 21 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: the rail line between dover and folkestone will not reopen until the autumn after it was damaged in rough weather .
campaigners protesting against live animal exports came head to head with police in kent last night .
more than 100 staff at canterbury college are told they are at risk of redundancy .

documents.title: thanks for joining us
text: it 's been another warm day in kent , but we 're off for the day .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 09:00 bst - join us if you can for all the latest news , travel , sport and weather .
do n't forget if you do see something we should be covering , you tweet , email or send us a message on facebook or instagram and we 'll be sure to look into it .
until then , enjoy your evening .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: kent olympian on the road to rio
text: sophie ainsworth , who 's from ashford , is making her olympic debut in rio next month .
the 27-year-old will be competing in the 49er fx class and hoping to grab gold for team gb .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: tomorrow 's weather
text: will you still need your sun cream tomorrow ?
watch my forecast below .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC weather

documents.title: the roads this afternoon
text: traffic is running relatively smoothly in kent this afternoon .
for more detailed information visit the bbc travel website .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: airport expansion delay 'making britain less competitive '
text: protesters in west kent say any airport expansion should be in the north of england , rather than at gatwick or heathrow .
but a pressure group set up to campaign on behalf of uk businesses says delaying the decision for any longer will harm the country 's ability to build an economy outside the eu .
author: Bob Dale

documents.title: dover delay : queues return
text: there have been long queues at the port of dover for a second day running .
extra security checks by french border officials have been the main cause of the delays .

documents.title: 'significant risk ' unaccompanied child asylum seekers will abscond from care
text: simon jones
simonjonesnews
chief inspector of borders finds there is a 'significant risk ' that unaccompanied child asylum seekers will abscond from care .
simon jones
simonjonesnews
chief inspector of borders says the demands of dealing with migrants in lorries had been at expense of other priorities like sham marriages .
chief inspector of borders finds there is a 'significant risk ' that unaccompanied child asylum seekers will abscond from care .
chief inspector of borders says the demands of dealing with migrants in lorries had been at expense of other priorities like sham marriages .

documents.title: folkestone and dover railway line to be completed ahead of schedule
text: a £ 39.8m project to rebuild the line between folkestone and dover will be completed by autumn , network rail has confirmed .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: highs of 24c in maidstone
text: yes we know , it 's not quite as warm as tuesday - but it 's still looking good for the weekend .
check out the weather for your area here .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: hospital trust placed in 'financial special measures '
text: maidstone and tunbridge wells nhs trust has become one of the first in the country to be placed into `` financial special measures '' .
author: Mark Norman
BBC South East Health Correspondent

documents.title: line between folkestone and dover to be completed
text: a £ 39.8m project to rebuild the line between folkestone and dover will be completed this autumn , network rail has confirmed .
work to repair and rebuild the railway has been taking place since 2015 , when the line had to be closed after it became damaged .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: on this day : a strike in calais
text: a strike in calais , a campaign for defibrillators in schools , and how a heatwave turned out to be good news for farmers in the south east .
it 's today 's # onthisday .

documents.title: kent draw after enforcing the follow on
text: despite 190 from captain sam northeast , sussex held on for a comfortable draw against kent in division two after being made to follow on at the start of day four .
full story here .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: how has your pet kept cool this week ?
text: we 're not the only ones who 've struggled to stay cool over the last few days .
here 's a few of your pets enjoying the sunshine .
please do send us your snaps - you can tweet , email or send us a message on facebook or instagram .
author: Claire Cottingham

documents.title: your top stories this morning
text: a wanted criminal released on bail , protests against live animal exports at ramsgate and fees could increase at the university of kent .
tom darby has your ‪ # ‎3in30‬ .

documents.title: the weather cools down
text: more cloud and less sun in kent today , with a slight decrease in temperatures .
for more information visit bbc weather here .

documents.title: john soares released on bail
text: a wanted criminal has been released on bail after lodging an appeal in the french supreme court .

documents.title: rail line damage delay
text: i 've been told passengers will have to wait until the autumn for the rail line between dover and folkestone to reopen after it was damaged in rough weather .
author: Simon Jones
BBC South East Today reporter

documents.title: campaigners clash over live animal exports
text: campaigners protesting against live animal exports came head to head with police in kent last night .
there were angry scenes surrounding the first shipment of livestock to leave ramsgate this year .

documents.title: a little cooler , with more sunshine
text: temperatures are cooler than the start of the week , but still feeling warm .
here 's your weather forecast for thursday .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC South East weather presenter

documents.title: the roads this morning
text: there 's disruption on the clockwise carriageway of the m25 this morning near clacket lane services .
for more detailed information visit here .

documents.title: hello from kent live
text: we 're here till 17:00 bst , with the top news , sport , weather and travel stories from around kent .
if there 's anything you think we need to know please feel free to tweet us , email us or send us a message on facebook or instagram .
gavin edwards sent us this wonderfully evocative shot of the unique landscape of dungeness - it 's our # photooftheday .
author: Claire Cottingham
